name: Tillandsia Cotton Candy
description: Tillandsia stricta, commonly known as Cotton Candy Air Plant, is an epiphytic bromeliad (air plant) native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Brazil, Venezuela, and Colombia. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features upright rosettes (10-20 cm tall) with small, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green to gray-green leaves with distinctive dense trichomes (scales) that give it a fuzzy, silvery appearance. The plant displays an upright rosette growth habit. Trichomes not only absorb moisture but also reflect light, giving many species a silvery or fuzzy appearance that helps reduce water loss. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive fuzzy appearance. It's popular among air plant enthusiasts for its attractive foliage.
careTips: Mist regularly or soak in water weekly
Allow to dry completely after watering
Can be mounted on driftwood, bark, or other supports
